Artem's place is a haven for families. With four bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, and thoughtful amenities like a highchair and pack n play, it's perfectly set up for a comfortable stay with little ones. Even though I didn't need it this time, the fact that they have an EV charger installed is a great plus – it's fantastic to know that option is available for future visits.
The neighborhood... It's peaceful, safe, and offers a sense of tranquility amidst the Vegas hustle. And let's talk about the backyard – it's huge and offers plenty of privacy. My grandson was in heaven, spending every possible moment outside, exploring and playing. The only thing that stopped him was the rain that started Saturday morning – otherwise, he'd have been out there every waking hour.

1. The host had total control of the hot tub and I had to contact him every time I wanted to use it so he could turn it on. So if I work up at 10am and wanted to take a quick soak first thing in the morning, I couldn’t. Water would be cold. I had to contact him asking to turn it on. And if the host is busy or not able to respond right away, then you’ll be out of luck on using the hot tub. Also, I noticed the hot tub stayed on when I was outside, but when I would go inside for 10 minutes or more, the hot tub would turn off making me feel like I was being watched.
2. The AC would not go below 71 degrees. The host had it locked at 71 and above. It’s Vegas, it gets extremely hot, 71 degrees May not be suitable for some people.
I’ve never once stayed in a AirBnb that controlled AC & the hot tub.

The house was clean, beautiful and had everything you needed to host a number of guests, 8 maximum to be specific so do not plan on having more than this through a single day. This was booked primarily as a surprise for my parters birthday very last minute. Although we do not consider ourselves partiers, quite the contrary to be honest, but when you start adding in a small close group of friends, family members and yourselves the quota can be a point of concern. If one is considering to book this unit over a period of several days be advised that an option is to fracture this group of eight or more on different days as to not break this limiting factor. Additionally pool curfew is strictly set at 10 PM as well as noise levels throughout the property will be closely and discreetly monitored via decibel meters throughout the rental. Another facet to be privy to is that security cameras for the safety of you, the property and perhaps to ensure guests are abiding to the aforementioned rules. These can be spotted around this Airbnb. All that said this by no means is meant to detract, just know what to expect. I would do the same in all honesty as an owner. Rules are founded by Airbnb, Vlad is just trying to abide. He is running a business after all so don’t be to hard on him and you should have a great time at the house.

So I am a very easy person to please, and the stay was great, especially with the price I paid. Was more than reasonable. The service was awesome a long with the check ups you all did throughout my stay.
I do have some feedback though, as these rooms normally go for over 300 a night. If I was paying that much, I would have been totally disappointed because we are being charged a 100.00 cleaning fee but there was nothing clean about that room. And in all honesty, I don’t know why I or anyone would pay a cleaning fee when it’s clearly not being used to keep the room clean. I sent pictures to you all to show how the room was with all the stains in the carpet, couch, non-working lights, and dirty lampshades. There was also a huge stain in bedding….
I really would like to request that I be refunded for the cleaning fee. It doesn’t make any sense that I pay that when the room was that filfthy upon check-in.
Other than that, everything was great. Service was impeccable.

review_text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay and liked that it cost less than renting a room directly through the property. The room is in tower 3 and has a balcony overlooking the pool and parts of the strip. There is free valet parking, which is a bonus. The towers have an indoor walkway that connects to the MGM Grand so it was quick to get there, which we really liked. The host communication was fast. The room seemed clean enough, but had a good bit of wear in the carpet and the bathroom sink handles were a bit leaky. I didn’t like the pressure I got from the host to send them a photo of my ID through a message on the app, but ultimately they agreed that I could show it at check in which I was more comfortable with. Overall, the pros outweighed the cons so I would consider staying with this host again if the price was right.
